description: Berhalter's removal follows a disappointing finish for the USMNT at this summer's Copa America tournament. Now, a race is on to hire a new coach with less than two years until the 2026 FIFA World Cup.
title: U.S. Soccer fires men's national team coach Gregg Berhalter

description: NPR’s Scott Detrow talks with Daniel Markey, Senior advisor on South Asia at the United States Institute of Peace, about Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s diplomatic tour through Europe.
title: Modi's visit to Moscow and what it could mean for the world

description: Some grocery stores in Oklahoma, Texas and Alabama have vending machines that dispense ammunition. Some say they're a safer way to sell it, while others say they send the wrong message.
title: You'll find ammo vending machines at some Alabama, Texas and Oklahoma grocery stores

description:
Four years after World War II, leaders from Europe and North America formed an alliance largely aimed at deterring Soviet expansion — the North Atlantic Treaty Organization — NATO.

Seventy-five years later the member states of that organization have come together in Washington to celebrate NATO and plan for its future.

As they did in 1949, the NATO allies believe Russia presents the largest security threat to their world order. The immediate threat is Russia's war with Ukraine, but the allies also worry about the future of America's leadership.

Eight diplomats from the nations closest to Russia weigh in on the threat the country poses to them and the world order.

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.
title: Russia is Top of Mind at NATO summit

description: Devastating floods in southern Brazil created more than 47 million tons of trash. It's a giant problem for the country that's having to deal with increasing deadly weather events with climate change.
title: Brazil has to deal with about 47 million tons of trash left after devastating floods

description: At least six people were injured in shark attacks in the U.S. since the July Fourth weekend. Such attacks are actually rare, but if you do encounter one, experts say to stay calm and move away slowly.
title: Shark attacks are incredibly rare. But if you spot one in the water, here's what to do

description:
The Israeli hostages taken during the October 7th attacks and held in Gaza are a major sticking point in cease-fire negotiations between Israel and Hamas. A spokesperson for Hamas tells NPR not all those hostages are being held by his organization, some are being held by families in Gaza.

And in Israel, what Gaza will look like after major combat operations end is the subject of fierce debate, with military and political leaders so far failing to agree.

For more coverage of all sides of this conflict, go to npr.org/mideastupdates
title: The Fate of the Israeli Hostages and the Future of Gaza

description: Biden has continued to reassure voters and donors that he is the best man for the top of the democratic ticket. But some of the campaign’s biggest donors are calling for his replacement.
title: Some of Biden's campaign donors are withholding funds, calling for his replacement

description: Some one million people are still without power nearly two days after Hurricane Beryl hit Houston. The local power company has come under intense criticism for poor planning and communication.
title: Houston's main utility company faces criticism and power outages persist post-Beryl

description: In 2022, a hitman was allegedly hired as part of a plot hatched in Iran to assassinate Masih Alinejad, a critic of the Iranian regime, in New York. Threats continue to turn her life upside down.
title: Moving from safehouse to safehouse takes a toll on survivors of assassination plots

description: NPR identified the company that provided Texas with execution drugs and uncovered that state and federal authorities alleged the pharmacy and some of its owners violated laws meant to protect patients
title: Unmarked cars and secret orders: How a pharmacy prepared drugs for Texas’ executions

description: After a mild fire year in 2023, California's early fire season of 2024 has had a busy start. A persistent heatwave is making conditions more challenging for wildland firefighters.
title: California's wildfire season is already proving to be a challenge

description: "Our office is reviewing Mr. Mitchell’s death as a homicide case," the Milwaukee County District Attorney's Office told NPR on Wednesday. Dvontaye Mitchell's family want accountability for his death at a Hyatt hotel.
title: Dvontaye Mitchell died after being held down by hotel security. Here’s what we know

description: Molly Baker was devastated when her husband died in a skiing accident. Then, a friend came up with a novel way to offer support.
title: When Molly’s husband died, a friend came up with a way to help: The ‘Calendar Girls’

description: There are a lot of hopes and dreams riding on the $8.4 billion agreement. A successful rescue of Paramount could point the way toward a shiny future for an increasingly uncertain media industry.
title: Paramount and Skydance are merging — here are 3 questions we have about the deal

description: A report from Nature shows that astronomers may have found a medium-sized black hole, a kind they've long looked for.
title: Astronomers spot a mysterious black hole nestled in a cluster of stars

description: President Biden's speech at the NATO summit emphasized a bipartisan commitment to the alliance. Health researchers push for age restrictions on who can buy non-alcoholic drinks.
title: At NATO, Biden aims to prove doubters wrong. And, should minors buy zero-proof drinks?

description: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell visits Capitol Hill on Wednesday to take questions on the economy and interest rates.
title: Lawmakers on Capitol Hill are expected to ask the Fed chair about interest rates

description: NPR's Sacha Pfeiffer talks to Rachel Rizzo of the Atlantic Council’s Europe Center, about whether Biden's speech reassured allies that the U.S. will continue to support Ukraine.
title: What did NATO members take away from President Biden’s speech?

description: In 2022, a hitman was allegedly hired as part of a plot hatched in Iran to assassinate Masih Alinejad, a critic of the Iranian regime, in New York. Threats continue to turn her life upside down.
title: Iran tried to kill her on U.S. soil. The plot failed, but she lives in its shadow

description: Rhesus macaques on Cayo Santiago are known for being intolerant, hierarchical and aggressive. After 2017's Hurricane Maria destroyed their home, the monkeys' society underwent surprising changes.
title: These monkeys were 'notoriously competitive' until Hurricane Maria wrecked their home

description: A 16-year-old became the youngest player ever to score a goal at the European Championship, powering Spain’s advance to the finals with a 2-1 victory over France.
title: Spain advances to the European soccer championship final after beating France

description: In the battleground state of Georgia, it's easier for anyone to challenge voter registrations of people without permanent addresses. Critics say voters who are homeless could be silenced.
title: Georgia law now makes it easier for citizens to challenge a voter's eligibility

description: Artificial intelligence is an electricity hog. Google says its total greenhouse gas emissions climbed nearly 50% over five years, mostly due to electricity that powers AI data centers.
title: Artificial intelligence's thirst for electricity

description: The pier will be used to deliver long-stalled humanitarian aid. Will it finally live up to the Biden administration’s hopes?
title: The Pentagon plans to reinstall the floating pier off the Gaza coast

description: The National Portrait Gallery in Washington, D.C., acquired the circa 1846 daguerreotype, which depicts Dolley Madison in her later years, at some point in her 70s.
title: This portrait of Dolley Madison might be the first photo of a first lady

description: Drugs like Ozempic, Wegovy and Mounjaro are in such high demand that many patients with Type 2 diabetes can't get them when they need them.
title: Ozempic's popularity leads to shortages for people with Type 2 diabetes

description: NPR's Steve Inskeep talks to Washington Post columnist Phillip Bump about if the Republican Party's platform, and a policy document called Project 2025 offer clues about Trump's second-term agenda.
title: Dissecting the GOP platform and what a 2nd Trump term would look like

description: A judge in Santa Fe, N.M., has sworn in a panel of jurors. Baldwin is charged with involuntary manslaughter for the 2021 death of a cinematographer on the set of his film “Rust.”
title: Jury to hear opening statements in Alec Baldwin's criminal trial

description: Police said they recovered Bill Stampfl's body from the mountain where he was buried by the avalanche in 2002, when the 58-year-old was climbing with two friends who were also killed.
title: The body of a climber buried by an avalanche 22 years ago in Peru is found in the ice

description: NPR's Steve Inskeep talks to Dr. Sandra Faeh of the American Veterinary Medical Association, about how to keep pets healthy during extreme heat, and warning signs to look for.
title: Tips on how to keep animals comfortable and healthy during heat waves

description: From graffiti artists painting camo on cars to dancers raising money for the army, this is a look at how young Ukrainians use their creative talents to support the country against Russia's invasion.
title: How these Ukrainian artists are using their talents to support the war effort

description: A Moscow court ordered the arrest of the widow of Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny during a hearing that was conducted in absentia as part of a sweeping Kremlin crackdown on the opposition.
title: A Moscow court orders the arrest of Alexei Navalny's widow, who lives abroad
